en: Return of the Table Mountain Pines

Karen Hughes, UT Professor of Population Biology, was involved in observation and research of the post-fire Smoky Mountain plant life, including the table mountain pine trees, which are unique to the Appalachian Mountains. “All the trees were blackened but those that still stood, and had a little bit of needles on top, we saw that the pine cones had opened and dropped their seeds.”

Karen Hughes, UT Professor of Population Biology, was involved in observation and research of the post-fire Smoky Mountain plant life, including the table mountain pine trees, which are unique to the Appalachian Mountains. “All the trees were blackened but those that still stood, and had a little bit of needles on top, we saw that the pine cones had opened and dropped their seeds.”
